76/9. Report of the International Atomic Energy Agency 
 
 
 
The General Assembly, 
 
Having received the report of the International Atomic Energy Agency for 2020,1 
 
Taking note of the statement by the Director General of the Agency, in which he 
provided additional information on the main developments in the activities of the 
Agency during 2021, 
 
Recognizing the importance of the work of the Agency, 
 
Recognizing also the cooperation between the United Nations and the Agency 
and the Agreement governing the relationship between the United Nations and the 
Agency as approved by the General Conference of the Agency on 23 October 1957 
and by the General Assembly in the annex to its resolution 1145 (XII) of 14 November 
1957, 
 
1. 
Takes note with appreciation of the report of the International Atomic 
Energy Agency; 
 
2. 
Takes note of resolutions GC(65)/RES/2 on the Agency and the 
coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic; GC(65)/RES/8 on nuclear and radiation 
safety; GC(65)/RES/9 on nuclear security; GC(65)/RES/10 on the strengthening of 
the Agency’s technical cooperation activities; GC(65)/RES/11 on strengthening the 
Agency’s activities related to nuclear science, technology and applications, 
comprising GC(65)/RES/11 A on non-power nuclear applications, GC(65)/RES/11 B 
on nuclear power applications and GC(65)/RES/11 C on nuclear knowledge 
management; GC(65)/RES/12 on strengthening the effectiveness and improving the 
efficiency of Agency safeguards; GC(65)/RES/13 on the implementation of the 
Agreement between the Agency and the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea for

the application of safeguards in connection with the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation 
of Nuclear Weapons; GC(65)/RES/14 on the application of Agency safeguards in the 
Middle East; and GC(65)/RES/15 on personnel matters, comprising GC(65)/RES/15 A 
on staffing of the Agency’s secretariat and GC(65)/RES/15 B on women in the 
secretariat; and decisions GC(65)/DEC/10 on the appointment of the External 
Auditor; GC(65)/DEC/11 on the amendment to article XIV.A of the statute of the 
Agency; GC(65)/DEC/12 on the promotion of efficiency and effectiveness of the 
Agency’s decision-making process; GC(65)/DEC/13 on the restoration of the 
sovereign equality of all members of the Agency; and GC(65)/DEC/14 on the 
amendment to article VI of the statute of the Agency, adopted by the General 
Conference of the Agency at its sixty-fifth regular session, held from 20 to 
24 September 2021; 
 
3. 
Reaffirms its strong support for the indispensable role of the Agency in 
encouraging and assisting the development and practical application of atomic energy 
for peaceful uses, in technology transfer to developing countries and in nuclear safety, 
verification and security; 
 
4. 
Appeals to Member States to continue to support the activities of the 
Agency; 
 
5. 
Requests the Secretary-General to transmit to the Director General of the 
Agency the records of the seventy-sixth session of the General Assembly relating to 
the activities of the Agency. 
 
40th plenary meeting 
24 November 2021

paragraphs.1: Takes note with appreciation of the report of the International Atomic Energy Agency;
paragraphs.2: Takes note of resolutions GC(65)/RES/2 on the Agency and the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic; GC(65)/RES/8 on nuclear and radiation safety; GC(65)/RES/9 on nuclear security; GC(65)/RES/10 on the strengthening of the Agency’s technical cooperation activities; GC(65)/RES/11 on strengthening the Agency’s activities related to nuclear science, technology and applications, comprising GC(65)/RES/11 A on non-power nuclear applications, GC(65)/RES/11 B on nuclear power applications and GC(65)/RES/11 C on nuclear knowledge management; GC(65)/RES/12 on strengthening the effectiveness and improving the efficiency of Agency safeguards; GC(65)/RES/13 on the implementation of the Agreement between the Agency and the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea for the application of safeguards in connection with the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons; GC(65)/RES/14 on the application of Agency safeguards in the Middle East; and GC(65)/RES/15 on personnel matters, comprising GC(65)/RES/15 A on staffing of the Agency’s secretariat and GC(65)/RES/15 B on women in the secretariat; and decisions GC(65)/DEC/10 on the appointment of the External Auditor; GC(65)/DEC/11 on the amendment to article XIV.A of the statute of the Agency; GC(65)/DEC/12 on the promotion of efficiency and effectiveness of the Agency’s decision-making process; GC(65)/DEC/13 on the restoration of the sovereign equality of all members of the Agency; and GC(65)/DEC/14 on the amendment to article VI of the statute of the Agency, adopted by the General Conference of the Agency at its sixty-fifth regular session, held from 20 to 24 September 2021;
paragraphs.3: Reaffirms its strong support for the indispensable role of the Agency in encouraging and assisting the development and practical application of atomic energy for peaceful uses, in technology transfer to developing countries and in nuclear safety, verification and security;
paragraphs.4: Appeals to Member States to continue to support the activities of the Agency;
paragraphs.5: Requests the Secretary-General to transmit to the Director General of the Agency the records of the seventy-sixth session of the General Assembly relating to the activities of the Agency.
